election_record.label: Massachusetts 1824 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: Beginning in 1822, the Original Election Returns for Governor and Lieutenant Governor for Massachusetts stopped listing individual results for the scattering votes, instead listing them simply as scattering. Any identification of scattering votes is because of results published in various newspapers.

sub_unit.name: Egremont
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Egremont.

sub_unit.name: Florida
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Florida.

sub_unit.name: Ervings Grant
sub_unit.note: The votes from Erving's Grant were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: "The votes of Chester were rejected, there having been two returns, certified by two sets of Selectmen." Columbian Centinel (Boston, MA). May 29, 1824.

sub_unit.name: Holland
sub_unit.note: "Not returned in Season." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Townsend
sub_unit.note: "Not r'cd in Season." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Tyngsborough
sub_unit.note: "Not r'cd in Season." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Weston
sub_unit.note: Marcus Morton received 1 vote as Marcus.

sub_unit.name: Boston
sub_unit.note: The Original Returns, which were not broken down by Wards listed the vote in Boston for Marcus Morton as 3038, while newspaper returns reported his vote as 3048.

sub_unit.name: Brookfield
sub_unit.note: Phinehas Gay received 1 vote as Phineas Gay.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.
New-England Palladium and Commercial Advertiser (Boston, MA). April 6, 1824.
Concord Gazette and Middlesex Yeoman (Concord, MA). May 29, 1824.
Metcalf, John G. Annals of the Town of Mendon, from 1659 to 1880. Providence: E. L. Freeman, 1880. 517.
